intro: Bunium macuca, commonly known as mountain fennel, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features a robust taproot and a丛生 of aromatic, finely divided leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The seeds are enclosed in a structure called a schizocarp, which splits into two parts when mature.
